intro: Gomphia magdalenae, commonly known as the Magdalenae gomphia, is a rare and unique plant species native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family, and is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear minute flowers. Due to its limited distribution and specific environmental requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species. Its botanical study contributes to the understanding of grassland ecosystems in arid environments.
